page.title: 15 Eglingham Village Hall.
page.content: The hall was{built in 1914}on the site of a burnt-down mill, mentioned in 1378, belonging to Colonel Milvain. The idea was Bishop Ormsby's.The vicar and Colonel became tenants.{In 1952 it {was agreed that the hall become self- {supporting}.Five trustees were elected {In 1960 major alterations were carried {out}including kitchen,toilets,lighting and heating.{Nowadays the hall is run {by a committee made up of officers and {two people from each group of hall {users.}They have meetings to organise fund-raising events to pay for repairs major ones helped by Alnwick District Council. Hall users include the{Indoor {Bowling Club,}the{Women's Institute, the{Badminton Club,}the{Parish Council {Youth Club}and{Toddlers group.}There's an annual{Leek Show,}activities such as{slide shows, plays and socials.}Our hall is well used in different ways.
